items.title: The Great Train Lottery
items.review_text: Trains continually cancelled from my local station to Birmingham…roughly 1 in 4 trains.  Those that do run are late.  A joke of a train provider (I use that term loosely).  Nationalised rail services cannot come soon enough.

items.title: Trash
items.review_text: Pathetic. I go out of my way to avoid using this rubbish service. Expensive and unreliable.

items.title: Unscheduled evening in Barnt Green anyone?
items.review_text: Re-nationalisation of the railways? Bring it on. Perhaps then we can get a decent service where you won't be dumped without warning miles from your destination with no alternative provided, no information, or anything approaching customer care. If this poor excuse of a train company goes to the wall as a result then so much the better. Can't happen soon enough in my view. On the upside, maitre'd at Cork and Crust in Barnt Green, who accommodated us while we waited an hour for the next train, was excellent!

items.title: Utter disgrace of a company
items.review_text: Utter disgrace of a company. If I could leave negative stars I would. Been waiting months on a refund which I’ve been assured multiple times has been processed. I will never travel on this Trainline again

items.title: WMR left me and twenty others stranded…
items.review_text:
WMR left me and twenty others stranded in Worcester last night.  Despite the promise of a replacement bus service we were left standing in the cold for an hour until most gave up and called taxis or friends to pick them up.
Unacceptable customer service. Do not use this train company.

items.title: Total shambles again
items.review_text:
Total shambles again. Delayed train on the Tring to Euston branch (again).
Train rammed in arrival at Bushey (again) and couldn’t get on the train. The next train was delayed by 20 minutes so had to take alternative and slower route, but at least reasonably sure I would be able to get to work.
Fed up of unreliable, unsafe service where passengers are in worse conditions than livestock. How can it be safe?
Management should be ashamed

items.title: quite good but not for a 1h trip!
items.review_text: the train I was riding on was your class 172 from b Moor Street to tyseley the train was a bit cramped because you were using your 2 car 172 to Birmingham from leamington spa the drink holder was used and nobody couldn't be bothered to remove it 🤢

items.title: Their services do not worth a single…
items.review_text: Their services do not worth a single penny but let me tell you that the same can be said about Avanti as well. Their services are absolutely appealing, tickets are ridicilously pricey, services are always delayed or cancelled. Their policies re refunds etc are absolutely terrible!

items.title: Wow - absolute rubbish
items.review_text:
Wow, second day on the trot and delays meaning I miss connecting trains and become late by over 30mins (so far)

It must be serious mis-management, and for all you workers and union people, the mis-management is of you lot.

You all strike for better pay!!!
1) you should be paid for what you provided which should be the lowest salaries possible 
2) they need to performance management you.

If you want better pay then you need to consider how to make the railway work and become profitable through people not claiming back because of performance issues.

OR

even worse we decide not to use as driving makes more sense and is more convenient.
I made a bad choice as has cost me more money to get train than drive, and not convenient at all.

items.title: As far as public transport goes I'd…
items.review_text:
As far as public transport goes I'd rather use a blind 3 legged donkey than to rely on this pathetic service. Not only are the trains never on time when they do run there normally overcrowded because there's only two or three carriages. I've been stood waiting some days for a late running train only for the announcement board to come up and say it's been cancelled, normally due to "staff shortages" and to stop staff shortages STOP GOING ON STRIKE!!!! Three weeks the trains were stopped due to a landslide, replaced by coaches that missed stations and picking up people, oh and don't forget the one that crashed under the bridge at Albrighton!! So three weeks having to find ways of getting back and forth where I needed to be and then finally when the train lines are back open again, 1 week later your all on strike!!! I mean are you taking the p***!! The best of it is when you send your little money grabbers out (conductors) you "expect" payment for your services, ley me ask you one question, would you pay for a service that's unreliable, unpredictable and more to the fact a bloody rip-off for ticket prices.
As a business your a joke.
As a public service..........your about as much use a d**k on a rocking horse. 
And just remember for the future when you lot "expect" payment for your services by me purchasing a ticket, my wallet has industrial action going on at the moment so unfortunately it's not working and I can't access it.

items.title: Let me down yet again W-ton to Coseley…
items.review_text:
Let me down yet again W-ton to Coseley (1 stop) but they can't manage it.
Why did they spend thousands on the W-ton ticket turnstiles and never turn them on? They must be loosing a fortune but it doesn't matter, they'll just put the fare's up until the shareholders are happy with the profit's.
I'm done with them now, I'd rather walk bare foot!

items.title: Rating a 1 as I can't possibly go…
items.review_text: Rating a 1 as I can't possibly go lower, was in a rush this morning due to bad traffic and constant roadworks. Purcahsed a ticket via the app, which you are recommended to do on the website, when I arrived at Five Ways train station the oldest man in Britain pulled me to one side and demanded I pay a fine of £50 as well as a new ticket despite having the ticket on my phone. After showing my ticket on the app he said "you only purchased that recently" after explaining my predicament, he arrogantly suggested that I should "book a day in advance" if anyone has used this service they will know that the trains are on time about once a year, normally when at least some of them useless team are not on strike. I couldn't believe that they asked me to pay £53 on top of the ticket that I purchased, the company is run by money grabbing, cheapskate tightwads. Meanwhile the employees they use are useless, pointless, feckless, lazy, work shy and bone idle.

items.title: Horrible service and the worst customer…
items.review_text:
Horrible service and the worst customer service ever experienced.

After numerous trains were cancelled for hours back on a day in October, we missed our flights.

After requesting compensations for the train tickets and new flights, the company never responded to any of our requests for months.

In the end we ended up going to the rail ombsudman and after a few weeks a resolution was agreed upon. 

However, even thou a resolution was agreed upon, which is legally binding, the provider has still not provided us with the promised refund. Nor are we getting any replies to our update requests whenever contacting the supervisor who apparently was taking care of the compensation. 

Case has now been again escalated to the ombudsman for further review.

items.title: Date of experience? Every goddamn day
items.review_text: The only thing reliable about this train service is how unreliable it is! Frequently cancelled trains (usually "shortage of train crew") or short formed trains (2 carriages instead of 4). Abyssmal. There's barely any difference between strike days and non strike days as you can't rely on getting where you want to go anyway. Diabolical.

items.title: Cattle truck experience, then no trains
items.review_text: I’d prefer a zero star rating, tbh, absolute chaos this morning, 11:12 from Gt Malvern to BNS.  WMT are incapable of a “great service” at weekends or in the week.  2 carriages, from Hereford, with the Christmas market? Enough standing passengers to fill 2 more carriages 😡 it’s a disgrace! And almost all the return trains are now cancelled.  Last Saturday before Christmas weekend?  Monstrous.  Plus we have to change on the only viable service . Not a service.

items.title: Refused to engage with genuine refund claim.
items.review_text: Delay Repay scheme is a joke. Stalled at every stage, passed my claim to Avant West Coast claiming I'd travelled with them even though my ticket wasn't valid on that service and who subsequently rejected the claim. Got through on the phone gave the details and put on interminable hold. They have no intention of honouring  genuine refund claims.

items.title: This train company need shutting down
items.review_text: This train company need shutting down. The board of director should be sacked. I had young children being squashed on a train that had been deliberately reduced down to 4 carriages. They lie, blame it on staffing, but it happens week in week out. If those conditions were at a sporting event, music concert, there would be an inquiry but this company get away with it. Euston station is also a shambles, like a third world country.

items.title: So I got the 14:15 train from…
items.review_text: So I got the 14:15 train from Birmingham new street to kings Norton I get on the train no seats.the trains are dirty graffiti on doors and train are late no sorry nothing in paying £86:00 every month to use this operator and I can’t even sit down and trams are dirty.if this was west midland trains they would of had they trains cleaned and enough sits for everyone to sit down.i wonder if cross country took of West Midlands trains at least they care about they customers

items.title: infrequent senior traveller used your service redditch to new…
items.review_text:
just used your service redditch to new street birmingham and return ..Couldn,t fault it... car park very reasonable price and trains very clean and well kept...
Ticket office very helpfull in all ways with great manner to explain times etc .. we dont use rail travel much except in london.. Staff at central station also very helpfull so well done all round

items.title: Disgusting how much they charge for…
items.review_text: Disgusting how much they charge for tickets when they are never on time, always cancelled last minute and leave you stranded in places where there aren’t any buses or rail replacements for hours! So bad

items.title: Held to ransom due to commute, Redditch to new street service is abysmal
items.review_text:
New street to Redditch line is complete waste of time always delayed or small capacity carriage trains sent so you cannot get on them. Have to delay getting home or getting to work due to this. Please for the love of god fix this route and service. 

On another note I also don’t understand how two different line services have such different train models and capacity. 

I will rely on Bromsgrove service in future the train is better equipped, runs mostly on time and is more efficient and up to date not from 40 years ago. I Just find it crazy I’m having to travel further out to commute as Redditch line and service is appalling forcing me to do so. 

Please can WMR also respond to my 2 complaints and refund my ticket from today as requested due to having to change journey at short notice.

items.title: Most ridiculous train service
items.review_text: Most ridiculous train service. They charged me twice because a train was cancelled (mid Journey! By an inspector). I have been waiting for my refund for 2 months. They do not respond to emails, nor my follow-up emails. Honestly I'm stunned with the lack of engagement - Finally got my refund processed today, but would not be surprised if it doesn't reach my account as they've said this 3x now. Use other means of travel for your own sake.

items.title: Drunken fight on one of their trains
items.review_text: I’ve contacted them numerous times re an incident on the evening of 11December 2022, where a drunken fight on one of their trains spilled over onto innocent passengers. I, an over 70 female, ended up outside Watford Jnc station late in the evening, over 3 hours late, covered in other people’s blood, cold, shocked and all trains cancelled back to Berkhamsted. I’ve asked them repeatedly to at the very least reimburse my taxi fare home. Their one and only comment has been that drunk people getting on their trains was nothing to do with them! Sort of sums up their whole attitude really.

items.title: Snow Hill station
items.review_text:
Snow Hill station to Warwick at around 1pm 
Completely incompetent staff and train information 
Three different staff gave me wrong info - train cancelled (it wasn’t), on platform 4 (was on platform 3), miserable and unhelpful jobs worth staff member at booth 
Almost missed train 
Total bunch of plonkers

items.title: We spend extortionate amounts of money…
items.review_text: We spend extortionate amounts of money for an absolutely diabolical service. None of the money goes back into making the service better. The fat cats just take all the money for themselves. I know writing this review won't change anything but oh well

items.title: Don't bother paying for 1st class!!!
items.review_text:
Booked 1st class tickets to London from lichfield for my girlfriends 30th birthday. Seating was no different from carriage, no drink / food offering, no WiFi, no table etc. The only notable difference above a std ticket was a glass partition between the carriage, which was wedged open. Almost 100 quid extra than std for the pair of us for no extra comfort or service. Complete waste of money, condition was grubby and littered.
0 star

items.title: Customer Services are an absolute joke
items.review_text: Customer Services are an absolute joke, I asked for one ticket to be refunded, they cancelled all 6 and then refused to do anything about it. I then got stuffed for £80 in refund fees for tickets I didn't ask to be refunded, and now we don't the funds to buy more. They take 48 -72 hours to get a response, but that's no good when your train it tomorrow!

items.title: Appalling customer service.
items.review_text: Trains cancelled and delayed. Missed a planned night out. Getting ticket refund is like pulling teeth. Three times I've called up. Three times I've been told it's requested and I'll get email confirmation. 5 days later (they told me it would take 5 days) no refund, no email confirmation. No manager available to speak to. Now told it wasn't processed and to wait 10 WORKING days for a refund now. I've told them to shove it where the sun don't shine I cannot deal with liars and imbeciles. Incompetent fools. And they're striking for payrises !!!!! They need a payout and retraining.

items.title: Crammed in like sardines
items.review_text: Yet another fun day out in London ended in an awful journey home, several trips have ended, and some even started, like this so this review is not based on one experience.   Packed in like sardines, had to stand up the entire journey, London to Milton Keynes.  Got delayed on a red signal for ages outside Milton Keynes which I understand was not their fault however would have been more bearable if we had a seat. Surely the way you get squeezed into these trains can't be right, does health and safety not come into the question.  I personally get claustrophobic, as I am sure a lot of people do,  and found the whole journey was just awful.

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text: Terrible service. The train from Wolverhampton to Liverpool Lime Street is always late. Train staff seem to stand around in groups doing nothing (talking loudly about strike action). If anything there should be a pay cut based on performance. The reason the Japanese can get trains to run on time is they have standards and pride in their role, our operatives do not.

items.title: Most trains cancelled
items.review_text: Most trains cancelled, with no explanation why. Train I did get was late, so missed connection. Stations grubby and in disrepair. I wouldn't trust this lot to run a bath. Still, I'm sure their executives get nice, fat bonuses for being terrible at their job.

items.title: Has to be one of the worst train…
items.review_text:
Has to be one of the worst train operators going. First week of new timetable and there are already delays without an explanation or apology. 
Chiltern no longer serve the area, which is a shame as they run on time and operate clean trains that are actually nice to sit on.
WMR needs to stop over promising and under delivering. Appalling.

items.title: Strike action and delayed trains have…
items.review_text:
Strike action and delayed trains have cost me just under 80£ on ubers to get myself around.
I spend more than £140 each month on a swift card.
I have had to contacted their complaints system THREE times with no reply.
If possible, avoid using WM trains.

items.title: Consistently terrible service…
items.review_text: Consistently terrible service travelling from Droitwich to Bromsgrove. Trains often delayed or cancelled with short notice. Two carriages during rush hour not uncommon. How people are expected to use public transport with such terrible service, I don't know.

items.title: Unacceptable filthy conditions
items.review_text:
Unacceptable filthy conditions
Outward journey Crewe to Euston- no advance notice there was no access to refreshments ie water. So nearly 3 hrs without a drink, plus a delay= Awful

Return journey = overcrowded, filthy train a further delay and had to sit next to a large urine puddle on the carpet for nearly 3 hours. No one to ask to sort it and no way to open windows. Absolutely disgusting. 

Complained to WMR - basically an apology and that’s it. Will never travel with them again.

items.title: Really nice ticket inspector Clare who…
items.review_text:
Really nice ticket inspector Clare who allowed me to use a ticket from another rail company Euston to Lichfield Trent Valley as my flight into 
Stansted was delayed so I had missed my scheduled train by 5 mins. Meant I got home before midnight after a long day's travelling!!

items.title: All the rail companies requesting huge…
items.review_text: All the rail companies requesting huge pay rises.. omg. They shouldnt get a.penny more for the shambolic services they provide, it is the worst country in europe for rail service and overpriced to the hilt as well as disgustingly dirty and overcrowded.. government should shut effective striking down if companies like this fail to provide service. All the bosses on massive bonuses as well.. disgusting company

items.title: An absolute disgrace of a service
items.review_text: An absolute disgrace of a service. First, prices increased, second, services Olton to Birmingham reduced to two times per hour during peak commuting hours, and then on the day trains get ... CANCELLED !!! How are people meant to get to work with your unreliable, untimely service?

items.title: Worse experience ever
items.review_text: Worse experience ever. We bought the tickets two months prior our departure to go to visit the studios in Watford, and they decided to close the station with no worning for the exception of an hand written poster at the station. Instead of a 20 minute trip it took us over 3 hours to get to were we wanted. And when asked for reimbursement of the ticked they have a 10£ fee. UNBELIEVABLE.

items.title: Refund
items.review_text: Booked and paid for 1st Class return London/Birmingham International. No 1st Class on return sector. WMR agreed a partial refund and took my bank details. This in November 2022. Still waiting and no response to follow-up emails. Expect it would be a small refund, not the point though, it's the principle. Nil customer relations.

items.title: My family and I booked return tickets…
items.review_text: My family and I booked return tickets to Birmingham New St on the cross city line . Our outbound journey went ahead ,when it came to our return journey the departures board just stated that the train was delayed. When asked stewards would not give a reason. It is obvious that this is industrial action and they are choosing busy times to inconvenience the public. You won't gain any public support by doing this none of us are fooled by your childish actions !

items.title: All the time delay
items.review_text:
All the time delay.  No people on ticket counter n if they are there tgen very rude.  Ticket machine always out of order and paraasites inspector issuing fine.  
Sort out ur machines.   One of the worst train company.

items.title: There should be a -5 rating for these…
items.review_text:
There should be a -5 rating for these people.

Customer service is non existance they disconnect calls intentionally they think they have all the power and can do what they want.

No matter how many complaints you raise they never respond. As they claim they have a backlog.

Awful arrogant staff the sooner these people got rid of the better.

items.title: Always cancelled
items.review_text: Always cancelled. Crappy excuses about driver shortages since 2019. Better planning and they could show ACTUAL trains that dont pick people up amd drop them off halfway. Then we could stay in our plesant homes or work overtime instead of waiting at crappy train stations

items.title: Shortened Trains
items.review_text: I’m sure this company is used to the poor reviews now. This is not the first time they have shortened their trains which leaves commuters unable to get on. This country cannot catch up work normal train services in other countries unfortunately.

items.title: If I could give zero stars I would
items.review_text:
If I could give zero stars, I really would. 
Stranded in Birmingham (Birmingham to Cannock) ,  told to go Perry Barr, replacement bis service in place, only to find noting in place. Got to Walsal (paid), then bus to Cannock had already finished. 
Not a single bit of communication,  and no replacement train like promised.
We ended up paying £27 for a taxi back home, and took another stranded passenger with us. 
Terrible service, will NEVER use again as this is not the first time.

items.title: Everyday when I go to work from…
items.review_text:
Inspectors bully passengers:

Everyday when I go to work from Birmingham new street to Aston, when I finished work, I go back home from aston to Birmingham new street. I had purchased the correct return ticket by anytime day return on Trainline app. The date is correct, standard adult ticket. One day when I am returning back to Birmingham new street. After getting inside the train from Aston, ticket inspectors falsely said that my ticket wasn’t correct and wanted to charge me even I already told the truth that I am really going to Birmingham new street!?? It isn’t make sense. This isn’t travel beyond destination. This return ticket is included inbound ticket from Aston to Birmingham new street station in the valid day like 12th January that I took it in the same day. Thankfully the other passengers stand up for me and said I really had purchase a valid return ticket. Then inspector’s didn’t took my details and leave me alone. Can West Midlands railway please changing inspectors working attitude? False accusations will make me have trauma and had negative feelings on using railway service.

items.title: Contemptuous scumbags!!
items.review_text:
Totally and utterly disgusting excuse of a company!!

Their interpretation of first class is packing a train so full that you have to stand the whole journey, letting blind children and frail pensioners have to stand for hours.

I implore you, do NOT use this company.  Find alternative ways to travel, use a different company or simply don’t pay.

These people are thieving scum, utterly contemptuous of their customers and should lose their franchise!

items.title: Untrustworthy and dishonest
items.review_text: Untrustworthy and dishonest. Delay repay claims ignored. When compensation agreed it does not come. This company needs to be replaced urgently.

items.title: On the app Refund Fee is £10 when the…
items.review_text:
On the app Refund Fee is £10 when the ticket cost was £11.85
This scenario is like a roberry. It cannot be like a percentage deduction???????
I have also asked in the ticket office: what if you buy the ticket there, you can refund them with no FEE !!!!
Hello? is anybody there??? 
The virtual ticket which costs NOTHING and DOESN'T EXIST in real world which costs ONLY my time then I have to pay a FEE?????
When in the ticket office there is a WORKING Real person, printing REAL ticket (paper costs of course and his/her TIME) and there is NO FEE..... 
I think there logical way is OPPOSITE WAY!!!!

And I didn't mention anything about delays/cancellations!! but not due Industrial Action which is understandable but about the FAILURES on the lines/stations.

items.title: Complete rubbish service
items.review_text:
Complete rubbish service..there is always a problem ,late,no drivers,no train at all 
17th sept Sunday there were phone charging points on all the tables in our carriage yet none were switched on..we complained to the ticket checker yet all he said was move to another carriage or put a complaint in..all he had to do was phone the driver and ask him to switch it on.nope, couldn't be bothered... everything in the uk to do with privatization has zero customer service

items.title: ABSOUTLEY FILTHY TRAIN FROM BHAM N…
items.review_text:
ABSOUTLEY FILTHY TRAIN FROM BHAM N STREET TO LONDON. ONE SINGLE TOILET FUNCTIONING ON A LONG VERY BUSY TRAIN .  OLD AND YOUNG PEOPLE. REPORTED TO GUARDS WHO TOLD ME 
" OH I DO APOLOGISE BUT I CANT DO ANYTHING ABOUT IT"
ADDRESSED ANITHER GUARD WHO WAS EQUALLY CLUELESS. WATER TAP NOT WORKING . 

MULTIPLE CANCELLATIONS AND DELAYS IN MY EXPEREINCE OF TRYING TONUSE THIS COMPANY FOR SOME TIME NOW HOPING THINGS WOULD IMRPOVE 
DISGUSTING CUSTOMER SERVICE .

DISGRACE TO THE NATION.

WOULD RECOMMEND PAYING MORE FOR OTHER COMPANIES

items.title: As worthless as ever
items.review_text: Once again left waiting for an overcrowded train because of the same train being cancelled two nights in a row, this is a despicable situation, this company has made everything worse, with appalling standards of reliability and shorter trains, despite their prattle about how they were going to lengthen them! Use a taxi, use a bus or walk, do not use them.

items.title: Extremely poor service !!!
items.review_text:
Extremely poor service !!!! 
There’s always train cancellations and delays almost every single day. 
The ticket price paid is not worth fit to the service we get !!!
The Stike action makes it more worse; I get late to work or can’t be home on time due to their consistent delays and cancellations, this does have an impact on time with family and rest because you can’t be on time to your home!!!
Today, I had to run due to train cancellation otherwise I were to be late from my work, they need to think about people’s health and the medical conditions they have!!
Not happy with the service at all.

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text: I was let down by a cancelled train in July. After various emails, 3 trips to the train station to find nobody working in the ticket office, posting the train tickets and yet more emails I have still not been issued a refund for the train which was cancelled. Terrible service!

items.title: Terrible service & terrible customer service
items.review_text: Terrible service: train cancelled with no notice, and they claim they 'changed the timetable' but no option to change travel plans or get a refund, even though the train was no longer going to where I'd booked a ticket to! Terrible customer service: no communication, almost impossible to get through to customer service, no option to call, email complaints don't get read properly, just receive template reply that don't actually reply to questions or provide any action. It's taken 4 months since they cancelled my train to get nowhere on a refund. I'd go miles out of my way to avoid travelling with them ever again.

items.title: Absolute shocking service
items.review_text:
Absolute shocking service. 

How can they sell so many tickets for a train. The train was rammed. They probably  sold twice as many tickets than there are seats on the train. 

Treated like cattle for an extorting price. 

Whole rail system is a joke in this country.

items.title: Driver boasting 'haha at least they got…
items.review_text: Driver boasting 'haha at least they got the heaters working now'. ...heater not on. But Aircon is. Every day. Freezing the carriage. Railways are so wasteful, Aircon on all winter whilst heating on, lazy station staff just gossiping all, they are all fat, barriers open for fare dodgers ... Clueless. Wasting my train fare ! Man I wish I could earn 30k for standing chatting to my mates all day

items.title: Poor
items.review_text:
Train cancelled.
Next train stopped at Crewe and told to get off. This was us now not able to get to Birmingham, we had to change trains to another platform.
Next train stops everywhere and no toilet - god damn awful never using public transport again.
Who gave this company a franchise should also lose their job.
I'm not allowed to give a zero rating otherwise I would.

I would love to raise a formal complaint but looking at this companies reviews I think this would be a waste of time.
Great staff BTW management should be sacked

items.title: Lack of staff/cancellation
items.review_text: Waiting for the 22:36 from Birmingham New Street to telford to find its been cancelled due to lack of staff. I understand there's a lot to do with the pandemic. But seriously WMR if you want to get great service you need to either hire more staff for the Christmas rush or offer compensation. Instead of leaving passengers on the platforms in the cold weather.

items.title: If I could West Midlands Railway 0 / 5…
items.review_text:
If I could West Midlands Railway 0 / 5 then I definitely would.
They are the biggest bunch of jokers I’ve ever had the pleasure (or lack thereof) of using.
The fact that on many lines, there is no alternative but to use their appalling services (assuming they don’t simply cancel the service with no warning) is a testament to the utter incompetence of the railways in the UK.
They are utterly hopeless.

items.title: I waited over 2 hrs in -10 deg C for a…
items.review_text:
I waited over 2 hrs in -10 deg C for a train. Nothing came down and no accurate information about what's happening.
Absolute shambles. The live departures boards were useless and not being updated properly. Does not care about it's customers.

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text: Terrible service! Since the strikes co-workers and myself have started getting the bus as they are more reliable. Thought I'd try the train again today, wish I hadn't. Always delayed without fail! I don't know what needs to be done about this it seems they have us over a barrel if we want to use public transport. They either need to lower the fares to reflect the service they are offering or get new management. Will be using purge methods of transport as much as I can going forward.

items.title: A word to the wise
items.review_text: A word to the wise. They are fining customers for not having tickets prior to travelling. The ticket machine has occasionally not been working at my starting station (Lichfield Trent Valley) so I've been used to paying when I've got to New Street on those occasions. I've also noticed that payments can be made on the train. On 16 February I was in the queue to pay at New Street when I was issued with a penalty notice for avoiding payment. It's a sorry state of affairs if they are having to find non-payers and additional revenue among regular customers queuing up to pay! Sort of thing you'd expect from a two-bob wheel clamping company. And don't bother appealing. They've outsourced appeals to a 3rd party (AS Regus) who just aren't interested

items.title: No space on the train to get on
items.review_text:
No space on the train to get on - forced to wait an hour for the next one which everyone ran to in chaos. Customer service has not been helpful at all - they directed me to Trainline which told me they could not issue the refund without west midlands authorisation - I went back to them and they have directed me to their website. A terrible service followed by dreadful customer service. At least their team was polite! 

Never using this service again.

items.title: Season Ticket Issue Scam
items.review_text: Here's how it works.  West Midlands Trains buy blocks of 'deliveries' from Royal Mail.  Royal Mail give them blocks of Tracking Numbers.  You buy a season ticket from West Middlands Trains and they send you an email saying the ticket has been issued along with a Tracking Number.  Here's the scam ... they haven't actually posted it and don't for many days/weeks after.  It looks like Royal Mail are at fault because they've given you a tracking number.  This allows West Midlands Trains to violate thier terms and conditions and you will probably have to buy daily tickets until your season ticket arrives.  These of course, will not be refunded.

items.title: Got nothing to complain
items.review_text: I had major concerns after going through the online reviews. But to my surprise, I had a great journey and faced zero issues. The staff was helpful, the train journey was comfortable with zero delays. Got no reason to complain even though I can be pretty choosy and particular about minor inconveniences.

items.title: They cry and complain about strikes…
items.review_text: They cry and complain about strikes where they have jobs as some people don't and one employee tried to con me buying 100 pound monthly pass which I found disgraceful

items.title: Bad bad bad
items.review_text:
Bad.  Cancel and delay trains often.

Also have a nasty habit of advertising a service, then cancelling it half way to keep their precious timetable in order leaving hundreds of people stranded miles from home.

Awful morals and behaviour

items.title: Poor service, all tound
items.review_text: Train cancelled at short notice, had to get a taxi to the airport. Have logged a claim to get my money back, refused first time, so appealed, said I would get a response within 10 working days, now on my 12th working day, and no response still☹️☹️

items.title: How is this company allowed to run our trains.
items.review_text: Only giving one star as i cant give any lower.  On Thursday 7 December  after most trains were cancelled I managed to get a very over crowded train into Birmingham.  It was so packed you couldn't move, at each stop the alarms would go off and we were told to stop messing about or the driver was walking off, pretty sure this was a technical fault on the train but it was easier to blame for the poor passengers.  The driver was in such a bad mood, slamming the brakes on the train and flying through  Tyseley so everyone who stood up fell into each other.  No one actually hit the floor as there was no space to do so, no announcements at which station we were at and you couldn't see out of the windows to guess.   Unfortunately i had to get the train again and of course the trains running at peak times are cancelled both in the morning and evening.  Why is this company still allowed to manage the trains in our area.  Absolute disgrace,  I'm going to work from home and save myself the misery of travelling with West Midlands Railway.

items.title: West Midland Railway appalling.
items.review_text: Every week, I get trains from Kidderminster to Birmingham Snow hill and it used to be an excellent service but now it is an atrocious service, you never know when or if your train is going to run. It’s absolutely ridiculous that the train company expects people to pay for such an appalling service. West Midland Railway needs to sort itself out and quickly. We have had covid for two years now and they keep using that as an excuse. People are fed up with covid and companies that use it as an excuse. Poorly management.

items.title: Ian the who is part of the revenue…
items.review_text: Ian the who is part of the revenue protection team. I hope I've got his job title correct was extremely helpful and friendly. He is an absolute credit to your establishment. It was an absolute pleasure to meet him today. Thank you

items.title: Overpriced and very unreliable service
items.review_text: Overpriced and very unreliable service. Had to pay £7 for a two stop ride from Birmingham and the previous week the same distance cost an extra 60p when connecting from a longer journey. Total rip-off. This country needs to encourage rail users and not penalise them.

items.title: Bring back British Rail
items.review_text: Bring back British Rail, better service 40 years ago now less and less trains stopping at local stations that’s  if they actually turn up. Nightmare getting anywhere in the west mids and to and from birmingham, second city third rate service.

items.title: Yesterday on the Birmingham to Blake…
items.review_text: Yesterday on the Birmingham to Blake street station 3.15 pm. Told to vacate the train at Aston station. No information given as to why. Told we would be trespassing if we stayed on the train. No other form of transport home, just left there to find our own way home. Asked it there were any buses we could get was told , don’t know, not got my phone. No toilet facilities no care for disabled passengers or the elderly, just left there. Got home at 7pm after asking a relative to come and rescue myself and my 71 year old friend. Was the most shockingly bad experience I’ve ever encountered on public transport.

items.title: West midland trains side hustle
items.review_text:
Got on a train from Berkhamsted to Euston.
Couldn’t buy a ticket because their app, Trainline app and station machines had a temporary payment processing fault.
Staff removed so no ticket office anymore.

No physical way possible to buy a ticket.
Boarded train and got a fine. Ticket inspector knew there were issues and refused to sell me a ticket.

The perfect con trick.
Got to laugh as they allow you to appeal up to 3 times. Each time you write in hope that their hand picked “independent” will side with you. 
Of course they don’t. You run out of patience and pay the fine. 

Nice little side earner for a private company with a monopoly on the train service yet can’t run a train on time or pay for cleaners.

Got to pay dividends I guess. Oh and bonuses.

items.title: National rail strike... but REFUSE to refund
items.review_text: There is a national rail strike on Saturday. West Midlands Railway's own homepage says that travel should be 'essential only'. My travel is not essential so I have asked for a refund on my tickets. Yet... they have refused. Over a long and protracted email conversation with someone calling herself Sheryl, she has REFUSED to refund my tickets in full even though they are at the same time advising me NOT TO USE MY TICKETS. It is utterly scandalous. And she says they don't even have a complaints procedure! What an amateurish, disingenuous, dishonest shower of money-grabbing thieves.

items.title: The power of a fifty pence piece.
items.review_text:
West Midlands Railway are attempting to take me to a Magistrates Court for a 0.50p discretion in my paid ticket, if I do not admit to a criminal record. 

This incident happened last summer associated to a train swap on a route, I had never taken before and where their own machines were out-of-service and no staff. 

I was confused with my journey and apologised for the 0.50p discretion; nor did I flee like several commuters did. I attempted several times to ensure they had their fare in person and in writing via recorded delivery. 

They offer you a settlement and attempt to blackmail you by using persuasive language in a 'Single Justice Procedure Notice' to help the incident 'go away'; ultimately leaving you with a criminal record. 
 

Staff fill out penalty tickets with incorrect details; undisclosed staff members names on penalty tickets. 


Disproportionate. 
Abuse of Power.

items.title: Couldn't run a hamster wheel.
items.review_text:
USELESS BUNCH THAT MAKE THE PREVIOUS USELESS BUNCH LOOK AMAZING. ZERO STARS
If you thought London Midland were bad, then this lot make them look like the Japanese Bullet train.
I use the Birmingham cross city line or the Birmingham to Coventry mainline line occasionally. Always get screwed over. 
West Midlands Trains couldn't run a hamster wheel. Recently received a rail travel voucher as a compensation for a journey that never started due to some pathetic excuse, that they have a book full of. So attempted the journey again only to get stranded yet again. Still have my voucher of which i may put in the bin because this circus of a train company is unable to provide you with any kind of service what so ever. Beware if you try to use this company to commute to work, loss of job will be a certainty.

items.title: Going from Malvern to Birmingham only…
items.review_text:
Going from Malvern to Birmingham only had 2 carriages instead of 4, as apparently they had "more than expected being maintained." Consequently large numbers of people past Worcester couldn't get on.

Coming back, cancelled the majority of services on no notice, meaning we'd be hanging around for three hours. On my way back via Worcester, where apparently a bus replacement service awaits.

All suggestive of not paying for sufficient resources to run a reliable service. Used to be decent service on these routes until these profiteering pirates were given their extortion racket. Shouldn't be allowed to run an ice cream van, never mind a train service.

items.title: Cross City Line Trains at England's…
items.review_text:
Cross City Line Trains at England's second city are not running today as there is " severe weather "or is this is an excuse ?

I travelled at Warrington as far as Wolverhampton when there were likely warmer temperatures at July.

items.title: It was a very bad experience travelling…
items.review_text: It was a very bad experience travelling with them. In the middle of the journey was be told that the train would be terminating at mid way. Yes the bus replacement was there but with heavy luggage dragging around from train to bus & bus to train was awful! Also yes there is a compensation of 25% of your ticket when the train is delayed by 30+ mins which is nothing compared to a person suffers just because one of your employees couldn’t make to the train! HAVE A BACK UP! Would be careful not to book with them again!

items.title: West midlands trains on 20/02/23
items.review_text:
West midlands trains on 20/02/23 

I was an hour late for work in Telford  this morning as my train got cancelled 40 minutes after the expected time

And to top it off 2 hours I have been waiting for a train home from Telford central, one hour of that has been spent sat outside in the cold, my train turned up 30 minutes delayed and then told me i wasn’t allowed to get on as there was a fault on that train, she stated there was one behind I could get but failed to mention it wasn’t due in for another 30 minutes 

West Midlands trains are truly awful and you should be ashamed

items.title: AWFUL customer service
items.review_text: Terrible customer service. I contacted them today via Twitter as my return train was cancelled and there won’t be any more trains running after 5pm so now I’ll most likely be stranded. They were not reassuring at all. They provided me with useless options and aren’t even concerned about my safety or well-being. No offer for a replacement bus even though my late train was randomly cancelled, I could be left stranded in London after 8pm. This was my only way home. I asked for compensation of some sort and was completely shut down. The manner in which I was addressed was very rude and blunt even after I expressed concerns about my ability to get home at such a late night. Disgusting customer service.

items.title: Stuck in Wolverhampton freezing cold…
items.review_text: Stuck in Wolverhampton freezing cold for 90 minutes waiting for the train to Coseley. Sick and fed up with the s*** service. No more, I've had it with train's. An enjoyable day out to Shrewsbury end's up a nightmare!😠

items.title: Where is my bloody refund
items.review_text:
Where is my bloody refund? 

Booked a ticket on 04/01/'23 cancelled the following day and was promised a refund, it's Friday 17/02/'23 and still no refund.
Phoned them 3 times and on every occasion I was promised a refund within 5 days/working days, 44 days later still no refund. They can keep the money, bankrupt fools.

items.title: Invalid tickets bought online
items.review_text:
Invalid tickets bought online. 
Both e-tickets and tickets I could print out with QR-code. None of them worked. No help from WMR. Luckily got help form other operator

items.title: These trains are constantly delayed…
items.review_text: These trains are constantly delayed with no apparent reason regardless of the day of the week. This is the most expensive & worst rail network on the whole planet & ai hate using it. But sometimes you have no choice.!

items.title: I would like to that Stuart Vickers at…
items.review_text:
I would like to that Stuart Vickers at the Wolverhampton train station, for his kindness. He went above and beyond  to help us to gear to Euston. After getting on the wrong train from Stoke on Trent . 
This man deserves to be recommended for his excellent customer service.
Thank you Stuart

items.title: Sitting on platform in Birmingham New…
items.review_text: Sitting on platform in Birmingham New Street for a hour because they waiting for senior conductor how ridiculous will never travel with this company again.if you want a smooth journey and be on time do not use these ppl they will not help you and customer service is crap

items.title: 2 hours late
items.review_text: 17 Dec 23. Lichfield Trent Valley to Euston. After an hour into the journey the train stopped for 1 hour as the changing driver was late. When the driver arrived, we went for 10 minutes to the next staion and they cancelled the train and forced everyone out to get the next one which was so busy. Arrived 2 hours late. 4 carriages instead of 8. The worst train company on the railways. Take the franchise away.

items.title: Thankyou Chris Blake
items.review_text: I am a casual user of the service between Cradley Heath and Birmingham and it has been pretty reliable until recently. Today 3rd August 2022 my train to the QE hospital was cancelled because some scum of the earth decided it was a good idea to steal cables serving a signal box. I told Chris who was dealing with the many anxious passengers that I had a date I needed to keep on a radiotherapy machine, and it was imperative I got there. He ordered me a taxi through the companies system but when one wasn't available soon enough he ordered me an Uber out of his own pocket. Thanks Chris I got there on time and the Uber was great. Hopefully you will get reimbursed sooner rather than later. Above and beyond in my opinion. I would add that all the station staff at Cradley are generally polite and helpful.

items.title: Fed up with west midlands railway
items.review_text:
Got up to get on the train for Birmingham at 7:12, trains got cancelled. Waiting at the station for an hour and also the next train was delayed, absolute joke.

What should’ve been a 2 and a half hour journey turned into 6 hours because I got told to wait at nearly every other station because of some problem. Worst Trainline ever.

items.title: Abasolutly usless same old excuses…
items.review_text: Abasolutly usless same old excuses staff didn't turn up so train is not in service person on the line or the constant maintance that seems to never ever get fixed what a joke of a service!!

items.title: Hi we travel to Birmingham from…
items.review_text:
Hi we travel to Birmingham from Redditch and arrived in Birmingham at 12.45 the reason for this comment is that the conductor who’s name was Rob
Was very helpful with his Announcementsi all the way through the journey and with the Covid-19  announcement 
We use the trains weekly and this is one of the only times we have heard a human voice he made the announcement at every station 
Thank you Rob

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text: Travelled to London & return this weekend (27th-29th Aug 2021). Paying for First Class was the first mistake. No difference from normal travel & no policing (people moving from carriage to carriage). Now I'm no snob but was treating my wife to a surprise weekend away, so I thought 1st class had to be done. Both trips were over sold & had people standing in the aisles so much that people couldn't get to the toilets!!. No air con on, the carriages were very warm, meaning no airflow (not good in the current circumstances). Just felt like they wanted to fill the trains & didn't worry about the safety of the passengers! I will never travel with West midlands trains again. A totally shambolic service provider!!

items.title: I was in a coach that was like being in…
items.review_text: I was in a coach that was like being in an oven - obviously no aircon! I tried to move to a more comfortable coach but there were no seats! Needless to say, I suffered 2hours of serious discomfort! These coaches should not be allowed as part of the train if they don't work. It is obvious they could have fixed it but chose not to. I hope the rest of the passengers in that coach complain!

items.title: Shocking Customer Services & Robdogs
items.review_text: Shocking Customer Services.  Absolute robdogs.  Disgusting. Paid for First Class tickets to London but the service was ‘de-classisfied’ because they had overcrowding (that’s being greedy and overselling tickets). We were told multiple times over the tannoy we could get a refund as we had to sit in non-first class seats, some people didn’t even get a seat! Been chasing since 20th August.  They asked for my bank details on 16th September (it’s now 6th October) I have chased and chased and been polite but they can stick it right up their back sides  Absolute rob-dogs. I would be ashamed to work for this company.  19th October, still no reply.  How can these people keep getting business.  Shameful

items.title: Dirty
items.review_text: I use West Midlands a lot because I have no other options. As per other reviews, they cancel a lot of trains with the same excuse which is no longer credible after more than two years of the same patter. I can actually accept this and kind of sympathise, but what really disgust me is the state of the seats which are so dirty and dusty that it is the result of poor hygiene. Why use carpets to cover the seats? yuck! If the tickets were cheap I would not be bothered, but tickets are expensive for the service provided.

items.title: Charged for ticket 3 times due to their system error
items.review_text: Yesterday there was a system error on WMR side no fault of my own. I got charged 3 times for 1 ticket. I was told it would refund on its own and it hasn't. Why should I jump through hoops to get my money back and then I bet they will tell me it will take 3-5 days to give me back my money. Absolutely disgusting, in a cost of living crisis how can you think it's ok to overcharge people and make it so difficult to refund. This is so inconvenient and terrible service. I'm still waiting for a response as haven't been able to get through to anyone and the phone line says go back to the station, why should I have to go back to the station! Give me my money back!

items.title: Horrible train service on Birmingham
items.review_text: Horrible train service on Birmingham, constantly late, when trains are late they just cancel stops making you waste time waiting for the train to have you just move to another train. What a complete waste of money. Worst train company in the country. Expensive and useless.

items.title: giving 1 star as it won’t allow 0
items.review_text:
Firstly giving 1 star as it won’t allow zero. 
I purchased 4 first class return tickets from Birmingham to Euston for wife’s special birthday. 
We didn’t use the tickets to get down but did to get back. 
On arrival at the train we were informed that the train would be 4 carriages long. The first class compartment was completely rammed with no room in the aisles. The guard informed us that the toilets were not working throughout the train and first class had been declassified as standard. 
This meant that instead of luxury and comfort we had no seats no facility and no service. 

On complaining to the company they offered £51 refund but then only refunded £31. 
Do not use this service. I most certainly will never use them again and will pay a small amount extra for Avanti where the service is excellent

items.title: I witnessed a racist act by a ticket…
items.review_text:
I witnessed a racist act by a ticket inspector, who was rude to a lady in front of me. I wrote a long-winded complaint with his details and not only did they not look into the matter, they didn't even bother acknowledging. 

Separate incident - At the moment, I have witnessed a clueless bunch of ticket inspectors today, that were unnecessarily checking tickets again, after 2 minutes of checking them upon embankment. Really not nice pieces of work some of them, with character traits that require therapy or some kind of support.

items.title: Absolutely Terrible.
items.review_text: I have been using West Midlands railway from Stourbridge junction to Birmingham for a couple of years now, there’s always some sort of delay, cancellation or fault with the trains. Sometimes they’ll even miss out stops due to running late, and announce this poorly and off time. Today I was on a train and someone was ill that an ambulance had to come on, if they are severely ill wouldn’t they be taken off and put in the ambulance so tell me why the train was parked up still for an hour and a bit? It doesn’t make sense, I even refunded my ticket and didn’t get all my money back. I am absolutely sick of this service, it’s not fair to have to explain why your late to college or work all the time it’s ridiculous.

items.title: Awful service
items.review_text:
Awful service, dirty scruffy trains, had to wipe down the table myself the toilet facilities were disgusting,  no water no hand dryers or toilet paper, first time on a train for a long time. 
 connecting train was a Chiltern train which was far superior to this lot in every way

items.title: The worst service on this planet.
items.review_text:
The worst service on this planet.

I usually get a train from alvechurch to REDDITCH and which is a 5 minute train. 
The train I wanted to get was the 16:18 train however this arrived about 15-20 minutes late (classic) as such I was unable to purchase a ticket for that train time. So I proceeded to buy a ticket for the next train and get on the 16:18 train that was late. Arrived to about 9 police officers and 2 ticket inspectors, and when I explained my reasoning for buying a later ticket, the ticket inspector accused me of lying about coming from alvechurch and that I had only just bought the ticket. I now have to pay a £50 pound fee as I know the appeal service is just tragic. As many people have said on here I wish I could give a 0 star rating

items.title: Can't overstate how consistently bad the service is
items.review_text: Sorry for the delay - but don't worry, because of the delay we're skipping half of the planned stops, and not telling you until the train has left! Consistently nothing short of a disgraceful service.

items.title: I wish I could give it a zero
items.review_text: I wish I could give it a zero. Terrible service always delayed or cancelled. Tell me any other service where you pay the full price but get less than what you paid for. I will not a buy a single ticket and tell my friends to do the same. Better to travel by car. Whoever says that travelling my public transport is good hasn't travelled my west midlands railway.

items.title: Excellent service @ Kidderminster Station
items.review_text:
I have today purchased a railcard and cross country tickets with such excellent help from Sally who works in the Ticket Office @ Kidderminster Station -she went above and beyond her role to help with our journey.

Many Thanks

items.title: No replacement services when cancelled
items.review_text: They don’t consider a replacement service until at least 75 minutes delayed. Why do we have such terrible train companies in this country?

items.title: Worst experience ever.
items.review_text:
Worst experience ever.
 I Book a train thinking it will be less stress! I arrive at the station 1hr early and then have to wait until 4mins before departure for a platform announcement. This causes mass hysteria and everyone else rushing for the train. The worst was yet to come as we and approximately 50 to 100 more passengers were rudely told to move away as the train was full and needed to depart..the train that I and all the other passengers had paid to get on! How is that  allowed to happen and be the norm? This is shocking and shouldn't be accepted. The staff were rude, unapologetic and didnt care, I was told there would be another train in 1hr....that train was also delayed on line which meant I missed my next connecting line. I ended up arriving home 3hrs late. Never again and shame on you West Midlands trains for overselling so badly.

items.title: I know all companies have problems from…
items.review_text:
I know all companies have problems from time to time but today I thought I would use the train to get from Near Walsall to Birmingham return. Their website would not let me but a ticket. Just giving a message stating
Access Denied
You don't have permission to access "buyticketswestmidlandsrailway etc" on this server.

Reference #18.bd3b3717.1638181289.5034ea7d 
I think this merits less than one star. How does these useless people get a licence to run a railway franchise. And how come they are allowed to keep it despite failing to actually offer a service.
And they appear to have no way to call anyone. The only way to make a contact is by email which may take days to respond. So I had to use the car instead.

items.title: Marijuana & Balaclava
items.review_text: Travelled from Barnt Green to New Street with my 11year old son at 5.30pm yesterday. On the way there two lads got on the train one was wearing a full balaclava with only eyes and mouth visible who my son said was staring at him which made him feel scared, so we moved seats as far away as possible. On our return journey, a lady sat just behind us but on the other side of the carriage and continued to burn/smoke marijuana. The smell was very strong and we were caused to move seats again to as far away as possible. The ULEZ zone for us means our car is not compliant so we took the train for its simplicity, relaxation and enjoyment. Unfortunately the carriage smelt, and there were no officials who to which we could have to brought these events to the attention of. Very disappointed. If we are going to be charged for taking our vehicles in to the ultra emission zone, then at least make the alternative mode of transport safe and more appealing. We will drive in future and pay the ULEZ charge.

items.title: Awful!
items.review_text:
Awful!
So many issues daily with their service. 
Birmingham - second largest city in the UK and the train service is so behind! Reduced service, cancellations. Price has gone up. Service has got worse. It’s just a joke.

items.title: My son went to Birmingham on the train
items.review_text: My son went to Birmingham on the train. He parked in the car park but the ticket machine was out of order. He then went inside to pay at the kiosk. He has a bank transaction proving this. He then received a FPN from the company that run the car park that then rejected his appeal even though evidence of the transaction was provided. He contacted the rail company’s head office to get them to confirm the transaction for the ticket (many other people will have been affected by this). They are extreme unhelpful and lack and empathy. They said to email to which they still have not responded after two weeks. The result is that my son has had to pay a total of £170 as his fine was escalated whilst waiting and he was threatened with court.

items.title: No never again yesterday was the last…
items.review_text:
No never again yesterday was the last straw. A group of us travel regularly to football. Twice this month no staff at station so not possible to buy cheaper group saver tickets from machine. Return 3 trains cancelled then when we do get on train asked to get off in mid journey. Then wait 20 minutes for another train to at last arrive home 
 A journey that should take one and a half hours took three and a half.
 Yes staff shortages but please tell us in good time then we could drive 
 That is how we shall be travelling in future. The CEO should just donate this month's salary to charity

items.title: Poor train service.
items.review_text:
Poor train service.
First class is a joke!
Second class on return journey was actually better!
No refreshments service on the train, dirty carriages, only one working toilet on whole train, 
Enough said!

items.title: Absolute awful service
items.review_text: Absolute awful service. Will never get the train again. And for the men of the midlands are vile people. No care for women or kids, pushing in front and not giving up seats.

items.title: I know everyone complains about their…
items.review_text: I know everyone complains about their train service but hands down consistently the worst train service I have ever had the mispleasure to use. I travel about 10 minutes by train as part of my commute should be easy right? The last 3 months over 50% of my trains have been cancelled. Not just late or over crowded full on cancelled. So hard to get money back from let alone bill them for taxis.

items.title: Horrible customer experience 💩
items.review_text: Dismissive, evasive customer service, 0 politeness... people working there either hate their lives or suffer from some complexion. Either way, they treat customers like rubbish

items.title: My honest review Birmingham NS to Hereford (bike storage)
items.review_text: Im gonna be completely honest but, i don't understand why alot of these reviews are 1 star. Today i went on the Birmingham NS to Hereford service and wow. First of all the bike spaces on this train are incredible, they make the most use of space such as stowing the accessible ramp. The bike spaces are separate to the wheelchair space and can fit up too x3 Bikes! To me this is amazing as you see all these rail companies with tiny bike spaces and hooks. The carriages were at a good temperature and the train is very spacious. Its a quiet service as the trains are usually a good length. You get power sockets with a USB port and a small trey table. The only downside of this is that there are no arm rests. Doing a 1hr 20 journey to Hereford and back can be quite uncomfortable without an armrest but the seats were fairly comfortable for my journey. There are 2 toilets on each set of unit. One thats accessible and one thats a manual sliding open door. Back to the bike storage there are even belts to strap your bike in the space so it cannot fall over when the train is moving. There are also chairs right next to the bike storage all these combined means you do not have to stand with your bike and you can have a stress free journey whilst sitting down and relaxing.

items.title: Worst service
items.review_text: Worst service, often delayed or cancelled. When claiming for a compensation for the delay, they'll ask you for the photos of the tickets then ask you all the info in the tickets. They make claiming so hard it makes you frustrated and waste your time!

items.title: Customer Service??
items.review_text: Fascinated to see someone has written a 5 * review for simply reaching their destination! Says it all. Oh and, as expected, I never got a response to my complaint

items.title: First of all the first class is not…
items.review_text: First of all the first class is not first class don't waste the little extra. Anyone sits anywhere anyway. And you don't get any extras. Also when travelling home from London it was terrible. I've never been on such a full train. People literally squashed up to doors and people screaming on platform to get on train

items.title: So so so poor
items.review_text: So so so poor. Train very poor condition. Doors opened minutes before departure. Regularly delayed without explanation. Avoid if you can.

items.title: School time service cancelled three…
items.review_text: School time service cancelled three times this month. Last minuet, all on time then cancelled, 11 year old stranded for hours. Total shambles! You should all be ashamed, all involved, no excuses!

items.title: Very poor Rail franchise. Is there any worse?
items.review_text: This company should lose the franchise. The Stourbridge line is a lottery. It might turn up, it might not. I have to get to Lye from Telford via Smethwick Galton Bridge. Should be ideal, with a 10 to 15 minute transition. But no. The train from and to Telford is pretty much always on time, never cancelled, sometimes a couple of minutes late but that doesn't effect my journey. The same cannot be said of West Midlands trains. If they are late or cancelled there goes my connection. I lose an hour of my day several times a week. They face the same manning problems as every other train franchise so why are they effected more? Simple, they were trying to run an operation with fewer staff coverage to maximise their profits and line the owners pockets. Strip them of their franchise and give it to a company prepared to run a half decent service

items.title: Wish I could give zero stars.
items.review_text:
Wish I could give zero stars.
Generally cancelled ( frequently at the last minute..) or delayed. 
I would like to use/support public transport but it’s so awful now, how can I ? It’s an absolute joke !

items.title: NO TOILET FACILITIES FOR BOTH TRIPS…
items.review_text:
NO TOILET FACILITIES FOR BOTH TRIPS MADE. HAD TO HOLD URINE FOR OVER 2 HOURS DUE TO TOILET OUT OF ORDER.

items.title: They will offer a refund but rob you of that refund to get it

items.title: No air conditioning / no opening windows
items.review_text: Stuck for 1 hour 20 mins on a train with faulty air conditioning and no opening windows on the hottest day of the year. Can't believe it wasn't disembarked and taken out of service. The guard onboard said it was because the AC system failed to reset properly overnight - so am following up with the Government Office for Rail & Road and the HSE to establish whether any potential negligence was involved. If this is a recurrent fault and other trains are being allowed to run in the same condition then their Operator's Licence should be placed under review based on a reading of section 2 of the Health and Safety at Work Act. Have notified two national papers and hope to have more information by the weekend. Any West Midlands employee with information relating to this issue should contact the news desk at the Mirror and ask to speak to the News Editor.

I should know , I worked on the railway for over 40 years and was always treated like sh-t,
I started under British rail who the management where pretty poor, but compared to them who have come along since privatisation,  they seemed semi competent. 
At every change of franchise it was always said by staff," surely the next lot can't be any worse" but believe me they always were, firstly ,Central trains, London Midland and now the worse shower " West Midlands Trains"
I had enough and retired but they couldn't even be bothered to say "Goodbye" after over 40 years !!
And also there is supposed to be a long service award after 25 and 40 years service, but I never got either,
Most frontline staff will go out their way to keep trains running, but the management don't thank them , just try and find a way of criticising them or disciplining them  for something minor.

items.title: Dreadful service. Appalling company with no regard for customers.
items.review_text:
Dreadful service. Trains cancelled in both directions daily along Birmingham to Shrewsbury line. Appalling. I can’t get back from work in Birmingham as I live in Albrighton. Was told my WMR ticket was valid on evening bus services. The last bus from Wolverhampton to Telford at night via Albrighton and Shifnal is at 16:30. Absolutely useless. If all trains are cancelled because of problems such as signalling Transport for Wales put replacement coaches on calling at Wton, Telford and Shrewsbury but WMR do not even bother to put replacement road transport on to Bilbrook, Codsall, Albrighton, Cosford etc. WMR are a disgraceful company who are riding on the back of Transport for Wales expecting TfW to get people back to Wolverhampton and Telford. People are then left to get back to their destinations by taxi or by getting relatives to pick them up. I am sick of paying for taxis from Wton to Albrighton (£22). This WMR services is completely unacceptable. 
The one Saturday services were cancelled between Wolverhampton and Shrewsbury because of signalling problems. I think a signalman was ill. I waited at Wton for an hour and a half and during that time no fewer than eight coaches came put on by TFW taking people to Telford, Wellington and Shrewsbury. There was not a single coach laid on by WMR to take people to Bilbrook, Codsall, Albrighton, Cosford, Shifnal or Oakengates. I had had a security issue with my debit card earlier in the day and the bank had had to cancel it. I therefore had no means of paying for a taxi. I had to get the staff at  Wolverhampton Railway Station to call me a taxi and charge it to WMR. I have complained to my MP, the Transport Secretary and to the regional mayor, all to no avail. WMR should lose the franchise. I think they are owned by Abelio. Enough said. Abelio run the Caledonian Sleeper and that’s a shambles too.

items.title: Given wrong information then charged a penalty
items.review_text: I commute to Milton Keynes from London for work and often buy a day return ticket. On 4 November I went to the Euston ticket office and was served by a blonde lady in her early 30s with a Polish or Central European accent on counter number 4. I asked for an anytime/service day return to Milton Keynes for the day. She said she had processed two single tickets for me instead 'as it was cheaper' at £36.10. I asked what the next train I could get was and she replied the 8.46am train (to Crewe). I then boarded this train. When my tickets were inspected, the lady who gave me the notice told me that my ticket was valid for Avanti West Coast only and this was a Northwestern Railway train. I was then issued with a fine of £40. I was very annoyed as 1. I had initially asked for an any time/service return and 2. I had asked what train I could get on and was told to get on this one by the lady at the ticket office. I appealed, and the penalty was cancelled, but 'I still have to pay £21.50'. Why? I asked for any anytime/service ticket to begin with, and asked what train I could get on next. Because of someone else's mistake, I am now being charged.

items.title: Unfair and Disproportional Penalty Fine
items.review_text:
I recently had an unfortunate encounter with West Midlands Trains and their penalty fare system, as well as the Appeals Service (AS) and IRCAS. The way they handled my case was extremely disappointing and left me feeling frustrated and mistreated.

Firstly, it is clear that the system lacks proper checks and balances. If the validity of my railcard had been verified before issuing the discounted ticket, this entire situation could have been avoided. A simple reminder about the expiration date of the railcard would have prevented me from purchasing the ticket in the first place. It is unfair to penalize passengers who genuinely weren't aware of their railcard's expiration, especially when it only expired a month ago.

Secondly, the penalty fare itself is exorbitant and disproportionate. The price difference between a full-price ticket and a discounted ticket is only £5.50, yet the fine imposed on me is a staggering £79. This level of punishment is unjustifiable, particularly for a student like myself who has limited financial resources. I would have gladly paid the price difference, but the fine imposed is simply unbearable and does not align with the nature of the offense.

Additionally, despite appealing multiple times and presenting my arguments clearly, the independent panel seemed to completely disregard my concerns and reasoning. The lack of consideration for my circumstances and the failure to address my valid points is both disheartening and unfair. It is disappointing to see the appeals process fall short of providing a fair and just outcome.

Overall, my experience with West Midlands Trains, the Appeals Service, and IRCAS has left me with the impression that these companies prioritize their revenue over fair treatment and customer satisfaction. The disproportionate penalty fare and the dismissal of legitimate appeals only reinforce the perception that they operate like con men and bullies.

I hope that this review draws attention to the need for a more equitable approach to penalty fares and encourages these companies to reevaluate their practices.
