items.title: Woefull customer services
items.review_text: Woefull customer services. 24 Hour 7 day a week train network with 9-5 customer service hours phone line- Don’t expect to be able to alt your ticket on line as a lot of tickets you have to call- Guess What! A massive waiting time to be told you can’t move it for free like it says on the website. £10 to move it (if they let u) & £10 to refund it….On a £17 ticket! It’s per ticket too so another £10 per ticket. Nothing short of day light robbery. Dont use. I hope Covid sends them out of business.

items.title: BE CAUTIOUS!
items.review_text:
Full day of trains listed, lots of options to choose from regarding times / prices. Purchased ticket 5 days in advance of journey. 

The day before travel, my train is cancelled and there are no alternative trains I am able to book on so have had to re-book at 4x initial ticket price via a different operator. WMR clearly knew the trains were scheduled to be cancelled but still sold tickets for trains that were never being run - PATHETIC!

items.title: Lovely old station at Great Malvern…
items.review_text: Lovely old station at Great Malvern (although totally unkempt and unmaintained - how much would a lick of paint cost, West Midland Railway?). The main complaint was the horrible attitude of the staff when my wife needed to use the toilet. Nasty customer service!

items.title: WTR naughty
items.review_text: Every day the same train gets cancelled with a different excuse. This is either the unluckiest train ever or WMR are lying.

items.title: Dreadful Service
items.review_text: Constant delays on the Cross City lane. Was hoping they'd do a better job than their predecessor (London Midland) but things are just the same.

items.title: Terrible service and times
items.review_text: Honestly wouldn't  recommend using unless you absolutely have to, trains keep getting cancelled and are ALWAYS late when they do arrive, I wish I could say I was over exaggerating but the trains never come on time and I just can't seem to grasp why the times don't just get changed, always seems to be just under 15 minutes late each time I'm assuming this is so they can't give you any compensation, as I write is its been 1 hour and 7 minutes since I've been able to get on the train I originally arrived for

items.title: Seriously terrible company
items.review_text: Seriously terrible company, if a leaf so much as touches the tracks or it rains or if its too hot or if its too cold etc etc etc they will just cancel your train, considering the price people pay for this 'service' one star is one star too much as it seems echoed below, the very first train I had to catch was cancelled because of a tree branch, how long does it take to at worst case scenario saw and remove, I could literally drive to the tree and use my own saw and remove it myself inside 15 minutes and lets be real, there are no Californian Redwoods there, they are all relatively small and if they do have trees that are in danger of falling maybe they should remove them and maybe replant somewhere else if they want to continue virtue signalling, less virtue signalling and more signalling your trains to at least run on time you inept cretins at West Midland Railways, actually are there ANY good train companies?!? As WMR are not alone.

items.title: 12:42 from Wolverhampton
items.review_text: Travelled today on the 12:42 from Wolverhampton. Had a very pleasant surprise to find the bestest looking worker I've ever seen on the West midland trains. Thanks for the eye candy 😉 have a fabulous day.

items.title: In the last month and i travel once a…
items.review_text:
In the last month and i travel once a week, my train from London Euston has been cancelled once at Euston then cancelled at the first station because the doors wouldn't close and on the other occasion the train was 15 minutes late so i missed my connection. 
The first time was the cancellation at the very first stop so i had to divert to Birmingham. 
I tried to get a refund but because i have been messed around so much i have told them to keep it and i would send this review.

items.title: I would have given a zero star rating…
items.review_text:
It's been 5 hours since I wrote my review below & I'm on the same train company back from London Euston to Lichfield. I realise that they are London Northwestern Railway trains not West Midlands Railway. My apologies to WMR. My comments still stand for London Northwestern Railway. The train back is as filthy as the one on my outward journey. (Initial review below):

I would have given a zero star rating if there was an option to.
I caught a WMR train today for the 1st time since the pandemic. One would think WMR management has not been living in the same world as the rest if us. The train was DISGUSTINGLY dirty. The floors seemed caked in years of grime; the seat back rests where dirty. If there ever was a Corona Virus breeding ground, these trains must be it!

At what point did the message of cleaning & making spaces covid secure get lost with those with responsibility at WMR? PLEASE CLEAN YOUR TRAINS WEST MIDLANDS RAILWAY!!! THEY ARE A HEALTH HAZARD!

items.title: Appalling appeal system and lack of…
items.review_text:
Appalling appeal system and lack of decent services. 

Like many other passengers, I have no problem with paying for a ticket with onboard, however I was charged a fine of £20 for a £4 ticket! I explained that a few days prior I was able to buy a ticket just fine with no problem whatsoever, and was told by a member of staff that they were instructed to fine every passenger with no ticket! 

Essentially, they pick and choose which day they want to fine their passengers - absolutely disgusting behaviour. As my journey was 10 minutes I found this highly infuriating with a great lack of transparency. 

My advice: avoid at all costs unless there is no other travel option!

items.title: Poor service, unhelpful, condescending
items.review_text:
The coordination between West Midlands and Avanti which runs the ticket office in Birmingham as well is so bad that I was charged 3 tickets for only one journey. 

It seems that WM has a standard practice to make money on fines and charging for undelivered services. 

It would be time to contact the regulators and question their licence to operate such a substandard service.

items.title: Utter garbage
items.review_text: Utter garbage, they use your data without you knowing and publish the photographs without you knowledge. Disgusting company

items.title: My daughter was instructed to board the…
items.review_text:
My daughter was instructed to board the train from Hemel to Watford without a ticket by a member of staff, to pay and explain the situation to a clerk at her destination point. She was paying cash and there are no cash facilities at Hemel station other than the ticket desk which at this particular time was being held up by a guy causing chaos. My daughter was worried she was going to be late for college.
She was given a penalty fare notice by the ticket inspector who, while on loud speaker, was so rude to not only my daughter but to me aswell! Telling my daughter she was a liar and telling me she’s getting a fine and that’s what’s happening. I have a letter from the staff in Hemel station confirming they instructed my daughter to get on the train without a ticket and the copy of the return ticket she paid for at her destination point which effectively paid for her 2 journeys but the ticket was then obviously only valid for one more journey to come home!. 
Trying to appeal the penalty in itself has been a nightmare, you can not actually speak to a human!. After numerous emails, calling numbers on the penalty fare notice (which aren’t even the correct numbers), attempting to submit an appeal via the penalty service website with no luck and going back and forth I eventually got given an email address to send my appeal to. 
I received a letter saying UNLESS ALREADY PAID the charge of £5.90 for the journey was to be paid, otherwise the appeal was successful and no further action needed. 
Well as my daughter paid for the 2 journeys she needed for that day there was no reason for me to pay the £5.90! 
I then receive a letter from IRCAS (which wasn’t even sent to my address but our postman clearly realised that was an error and delivered it to me) demanding £40.90p as I hadn’t paid the £5.90 within 14 days. I emailed them explaining the full amount was already paid on the day only to get a reply saying I need to re-appeal to penalty service but that the £40.90p won’t be put on hold while I do this so I still owe it!
Absolutely disgusting service! You can’t possibly speak to anybody about it, had I not spent the time digging around to get an email address there would be no other options on phone lines or letters than to pay money I didn’t owe!. This is an ongoing matter but I refuse to accept responsibility for the actions caused by a member of West Midlands staff and I also refuse to pay IRCAS £40.90p when the full train fare was paid on the day already and the penalty service can’t check supporting documents properly in the first place!

items.title: Worst Railway Service
items.review_text: Worst Railway Service I have ever experienced. For the past three weeks my afternoon train has been delayed or cancelled almost every single day! This is absolutely ridiculous! They keep promising they'll improve since last year but the service is continuously appalling! Can the West Midlands Government please step in and strip them of their franchise! Horrible horrible service, shut them down!

items.title: Ridiculous conductors with lack of knowledge of their job!!!
items.review_text:
They charged me fine even though I traveled off peak time with off peak tickets. 
On the website, it clearly says off peak time starts from 9:30am and need to arrive to london after 10am. 
I’ve taken a train from Watford Junction at 9:38am (it was 1min delayed and arrived at Euston at 10:03am) 
I’ve even showed their website says off peak starts from9:30am.
But the conductors (Amos and Tony) told me I’m wrong cuz Railcard can use from 10am. But in fact, i need to arrive to London after 10am. And the train arrived 10:03am. So I did nothing wrong!
They charged me fine 21.60 cuz they said I have to travel after 10am from Watford Junction.
But they were totally wrong and I’ve even showed them the proof that I am right.
But they were like “No! You should leave after 10am!” And never refunded me.
I’ve asked their name and I said it’s ok. I’m gunna claim for this. 
You know what Tony said!? Claim for what with laughing!
They don’t know how to speak and treat customers cuz they are protected by Unions. 
That’s why Their customer service is sucks and they don’t know our train fees going to their salary and they don’t know what is customer service is and how to treat their customers!
They are just no knowledge of their job and just stealing money from customers with unreasonable reasons!
They should be fired or need customer service trainings at least!!!!!!!!

items.title: Absolute shamble service
items.review_text: Absolute crap service, every morning the trains are either cancelled or delayed, don’t know how something so simple can be so faulty, bolloks, learn from other countries and fix your service, people are now going to be late for work etc, this happens at least 3/4 out of 5 working days a week, don’t bother paying for a ticket either if it’s delayed or cancelled, making passengers wait in the cold because old train driver Bob couldn’t be arsed to get his fat ass out of bed this morning to ensure the train runs on time, hope this company folds and gets taken over by a much more organised, efficient train service.

items.title: It would be no stars if that was an…
items.review_text:

CoVID cant be blamed for it  WMT have been this inefficient since they took over.
It's a disgrace.

Seems WMR don’t care enough about their rule abiding customers (many of whom are key workers) to bother protecting them. I’ll be back in my car rather than take my chances. items.title: Less / reduced trains

items.title: This is an awful company and a very…
items.review_text:
This is an awful company and a very insulting one too.  I received such poor service one morning that I had to take a taxi.  I complained and was eventually sent an email by someone called Lucy Bonnell who promised me that they would be sending me a cheque for £20 to cover the taxi cost.

14 days past and no cheque arrived.  I emailed to find out where it was and got no response.   I then emailed again to find out and it seemed to log it as a new complaint.

As of now it's nearly 2 months since I was promised a cheque and now the 20 quid that I initially accepted seems a massive insult what with the disrespect and the hassle.

I you try and call them whether it's complaints or not, it's basically a scam to try and get you to do everything online and not actually talk to a person.

I now want more than the £20 taxi fare and I want some apology for the shi tty way this has been handled.

Next time I hear of their staff being assaulted I will smile a little

items.title: Constant delays or cancellations
items.review_text: Constant delays or cancellations. I’m a season ticket holder and get very frustrated that the service lets me down. Often late to work or late home for family.

items.title: Yikes

items.review_text: We were 2minutes late in to new street because we sat in a tunnel breathing in fumes waiting. And 5 minutes late onthe way back yo rugeley town. Not good

items.title: Today
items.review_text:
Today, February 26. Stourbridge to Tyseley. 09.37 was 15 minutes late, which meant that because so called,‘congestion’ it was decided to omit several stops including tyseley. Obviously this was done for ‘operational reasons’ and not for benefit of public. There weren’t any apologies or advice given. Very poor customer relations. 
I understand that the practice of missing out stations for operational reasons was to cease. Not so it seems. 
I was delayed by 45 minutes as a result. That means 105 minutes for the journey. Why is the tyseley service so poor?
Dr P J Stamper

items.title: Friendly staff, but no luggage space for suitcases and you get back  pain from the seats
items.review_text: I started my train journey with a kind ticket collector and welcoming staff. Luckily there was not many people on the train , so we had space for our luggage ,but if it was full you would have a problem as there was no luggage holders for suitcases or heavy luggage. That was no big deal for me but the seats were awful I had only been in the train for a while when I got a really bad pain in my back. I thought it was just me , but it turns out everyone’s back was hurting due to the seats. Overall everything was clean , but they need a luggage storage space for suitcases and need to change the shape of the seats .

items.title: Just on train in middle of storm Dennis…
items.review_text: Just on train in middle of storm Dennis (?) and the conductor is asking everyone for their destination and is checking their trains are running and giving advice for alternatives if there is a cancellation. That's great service. Everyone seems very grateful.

items.title: Worst service ever
items.review_text:
I commute daily to London from Rugby. The 7.11am is always over-crowded and the isles and lobbies are crammed with people having to stand. We have a pregnant lady who doesnt have a seat this morning. There is never enough coaches. 

This has been the case for at least 8 months and the train operator has not addressed the issue. 

Similar case on evenings back aswell. 

Dont by first class as this the London Midlands operator often declassifies the carriage.

items.title: 1 star is being nice
items.review_text:
I'd give this company 0 stars if I could.
They make it as hard as possible to get a refund, everybody in customer service just directs you to their poorly designed useless website.

Stay away if you can afford other providers, if you have a problem with WMR, good luck getting it sorted.

items.title: Daily disgrace.
items.review_text:
Daily disgrace.
Constantly late without any explanation, serious overcrowding on their trains. Crowd control is required. A journey with this opearator is unsafe. They are an accident waiting to happen.

items.title: Absolutely diabolical
items.review_text: Absolutely diabolical.  Rude and unhelpful staff.  Delayed trains.  Extortionate prices.  Condescending and misleading notices around the stations and platforms.

8,15 train

Packed platform

items.title: Disappointing
items.review_text: Everytime I get a train ticket from Birmingham to London euston with West Midlands Railway I get disappointed. Every single time it is either delayed or cancelled. Cancellations not even related to severe situations , for example the train was cancelled on 26th Jan 20, due to a crew member being unavailable, is there no cover? do you have to cancel the whole service and ruin over 100 people's plan and delay their journey? The ticket was not cheap, and the service was not good at all. I had to wait at the station for over an hour so that I could get another train to Euston which took 2h and 30 minutes, when I could get the train I booked a ticket for for only 1h and 40 minutes if wasn't cancelled. very disappointing.

items.title: Systemic failures
items.review_text: Appalling service, London Midland was a better service and that is saying a lot. WMR cross-city line cannot cope with the passenger load due to small carriages (3 instead of 6 at rush hour 8am, London Midland had a 6 carriage service at this time), lack of staff, 'operational issues' and a timetable which they do not have the infrastructure to uphold. This week (commencing 13JAN20) I have taken a return journey on my daily commute, 8 journeys and 7 of those were behind schedule ranging from 5-15 minutes. This means alot of the trains are backed up and on two seperate days I had to watch as 2 trains passed by without any room to get on, needless to say a 5 mile, 10 minute train journey took me an hour to complete and I was late for work on 2 occasions. I'm glad that Andy Street has threatened these guys with losing the franchise as they are not fit for purpose, London Midland were awful, these guys are atrocious!

items.title: Abysmal is not really strong enough to…
items.review_text: Abysmal is not really strong enough to describe this so called service. Cancellations, continual late departures, (in the unlikely event of an on time departure it arrives ten minutes late).  There are simply not enough carriages when required at peak time. The consequent overcrowding is part of the service is awful and cruel. The other service included in the ticket price is for the train to stop and go back several stations from your destination, leaving you either stranded or wet and cold waiting from the next one that might or might not take you to your destination. I could write another  page but in keeping with WMR, I just cancelled it.

items.title: Terrible doesn't quite some it up
items.review_text:
I get the train everyday in to New St and back again from Gravelly Hill/Erdington. The trains are completely rammed, which usually results in me being late to work. I have tried to leave out earlier and surprise surprise those trains are just as packed. 

Cancellations and delays have also become the norm.

I don't understand how we are asking people to not drive into work when the train services are this shocking. 

How difficult is it to add a few more carriages for the early morning and after work trains.

items.title: WMR DISGUSTING SERVICE!!!!!!
items.review_text:
Well I am extremely shocked at why WMR have 0 people who have voted excellent, I wonder if its because of the poor condition of carriages or late services every single day or cancellations on a regular basis or the rude staff that think its acceptable to ignore you when you ask for an update or the twitter team at WMR dont respond to any tweets except nice ones but when you ask for help 0 reply or the overcrowding on platforms due to delays and cancellation or the service before hand cancelled so they send in the next train with 2 carriages. Yes I think it might be all of them things to be honest, absolutely disgusting company and hope they get the franchise removed end of Jan.
Thanks WMR for making me late on a regular occurence to work and making me late for child care, oh and not responding to any complaint so I look forward to the Rail Ombudsman stepping in to help.
USELESS AND DISGRACEFUL COMPANY

items.title: WMR Absolutely disgusting service

Also the later trains have less carriages when more people are trying to get on. Surely this isn't the way to encourage people to use public transport. Absolutely awful!

items.title: Worst service since they took over
items.review_text: Worst service since they took over.   Trains always late or cancelled and rammed to th Epping where you can’t get on them or are crushed. Never had any of these problems until they took over.  Job threatened because I no longer get to work on time.

items.review_text: First class shouldn’t be allowed to be sold as a service !! Disgusting.

items.title: Beware if you make a mistake with online bookings
items.review_text:
Booked a ticket late at night online but made a mistake with the date (easily done when not too familiar with online booking). Rang West Midlands  Railway the next morning to try and get it changed. They wanted more than the price of the ticket in admin fees to change it. 
Customer service obviously an alien concept.  Guess I shouldn't be surprised considering the state of the rail system in this country.

items.title: Fares vs service received = unreal
items.review_text: On the 2-3 times per week I use this service (Euston-Watford) there’s always some issue. Either a delay, cancellation or over crowded.  Some of the trains are so old and just today it stopped suddenly on the track due to a door issue. The train is so old it sounds like it’s going to break!  And we pay £2500 per year!   Unreal.

items.title: I've put in 4 complaints in less than a…
items.review_text:
I've put in 4 complaints in less than a week. 13th Dec last 3 consecutive trains New Street to Lichfield cancelled with no replacement bus.
14th Dec got on train at New Street to Lichfield only to be told to get off at Aston as train was now cancelled.
18th Dec New Street to Lichfield train arrived on New Street platform 8 minutes late and didn't move for a further 8 minutes making it 16 minutes late with no explanation.
19th Dec New Street to Lichfield 20 15, 20.27 & 20.36 cancelled, no crew apparently.
Absolutely shocking service, it's put me off travelling by train.

items.title: Avoid at all costs
items.review_text: Avoid at all costs, trains often shortformed and cancelled due to shortage of train crew with no date as to when issues will be solved. Shambolic train company that almost make me miss London Midland

items.title: Awful service.

Awful service.
Not enough staff
Any excuse to cancel or delay trains.
Patronising messages over tannoy.
DO NOT TRAVEL ON THE TRAIN IN WEST MIDLANDS.

items.title: Why is the wifi so poor
items.review_text: Why is the wifi so poor ? Useless

items.title: Atrocious service.
items.review_text:
Atrocious service.
LIke others, I am disgusted with the service offered by WMR.  Trains are consistently late, the excuse is usually shortage of train crew.  Well, it isn't rocket science is it - if you consistently have a shortage of crew, you need more staff.  If you don't have sufficient staff to maintain the timetable, then why did you bid for the work, and why were you successful??  The service is a joke.  Instead of investing loads of money in new trains (which yes, would be nice) why not spend some money on getting the ones you have running properly first.  It is madness to think you have to aim for a train which is at least 3 in advance of the train you actually need because you can't guarantee that there won't be cancellations.  I have never been so disappointed in any train service.  Sort it out please.

items.title: Very poor service
items.review_text:
Day after day trains are either delayed or more often cancelled, with the usual host of poor excuses trotted out. Tonight two trains consecutively were cancelled leading to large crowds trying to pack into the next one that finally turned up. Against the backdrop of yet another inflation busting ticket increase this is very disappointing.

Regrettably unable to give zero stars because this shambles of a company certainly doesn’t deserve anything more.

items.title: Rubbish.
items.review_text: Rubbish. Frequently late or cancelled due to insufficient staffing, just hopeless. I pay almost 2,000 a year and am seriously thinking of driving instead, as service so unreliable.

items.title: West Midlands Railway - disgraceful
items.review_text: I do not understand how this company is allowed to get away with the number of cancellations/delays they have! Trains are overcrowded to the point where health and safety is not even considered. Train times are rubbish and sometimes they send less carriages on an already overcrowded train on a good day (during peak times). They keep increasing the cost of the ticket yet the service gets worse and worse! I pay monthly for a ticket and don’t even get a seat, I’m paying to stand on a train?! Ridiculous, definantly not getting your monies worth here!

items.title: Possibly the worst train company ever
items.review_text: Possibly the worst train company ever. The only thing you can relie on is that their trains are always late if they run at all.  Very defensive costumer service people. It's never their fault and we should be more patient. The thing they do that really annoys me is that they don't list trains as cancelled on their website, they simply delete the train listing like it didn't exist in the first place. As if customers won't notice that their train home has suddenly disappeared from the schedule!

items.title: Awful.
items.review_text:
I rely on this company to get to and from work. I work late, so cancelled and delayed trains can really be stressful. So far, not w single shift has passed without a train being delayed, late, or cancelled with no warning.

The staff tend to be ignorant, and offer no explanations either. Terrible company, overpriced.

items.title: Poor reliability due to poor planning and staff shortages
items.review_text: Terrible reliability for a commuter to Bham N Street. Services regularly delayed or cancelled due to staff shortages. Total lack of responsibility towards their customers. I use two different routes to commute depending on which one I think I stand a better chance of getting successfully back home on, unfortunately both are still operated by West Midlands trains and neither are particularly reliable. I really hope that they will improve their service because I know I am not alone in my experience of this service.

items.title: Credit Card Security risk
items.review_text:
Dreadful company, I had to give them my credit card detail to get a one off  delay refund but they cannot tell me  if afterwards my card detail will be removed from their system. 
I have been ping-ponged from one dept to another, given email addresses that did not work. Told that I will be transferred to escalation team - music plays - then  call cuts off???? 
Let with only option to get in touch with my credit card company and make them aware of this security risk at West Midlands Railway.

items.title: Absolute joke of a train operator
items.review_text: Absolute joke of a train operator, it’s 10.15pm and the train is over crowded to the point someone has fainted and to top it off the train is massively behind schedule. Until someone gets hold of this train route and operates and efficient service the West Midlands will get left behind in the dark ages! A horse and carriage would move quicker!

items.title: The filthy dirty express to Hereford
items.review_text: Return train journey from Worcester to Hereford today.   Without any doubt whatsoever,  this was the most disgusting   filthy dirty train I have ever been on, ever, and I've travelled on any number all over the world.  I know we're supposed to be getting new trains... but for heaven's sake,  get a bloody vacuum cleaner out in the meantime.   This train had clearly not received any attempt at cleaning for weeks   if not months.  The carpet was plastered in mud and chewing gum,  the seats were too disgusting to sit on, the windows opaque with grime. Even the exterior of the train was so filthy you could hardly read the company logo.. perhaps that's the idea... Sorry West Midlands Railway, ontop of all the delays this is absolutely not acceptable customer service in 2019. You are showing all the signs of a failing company that will loose it's franchise very quickly indeed due to incompetence & malpractice.

items.title: Zero stars
items.review_text: Didn't think it was possible to e worse than the previous operator but they've managed it. Cancellations and delays are awful but the thing that really gets me is the overcrowding. If the train turns up you can't get on because it's already full or if you do manage to squeeze on you wish you hadn't because the journey is so awful. The overcrowding actually feels unsafe. It's also really unpleasant to be intimately squashed up against men that you don't know. It's boiling but you can't move enough to take your coat off. I don't go all the way to Snow Hill so trying to get off at my stop is a nightmare. People by the doors don't want to get off the train to allow everyone else to shuffle out the way of the odd person trying to depart. I understand why as they can't always get back on in the mad scrum when people trying to board the train can see most of them aren't going to get on. I've commuted with a season ticket for 10 years and this is the worst its ever been. I dread the journey so much that I'm actually considering leaving a job I love just to escape the journeys from hell. Sick of hearing about the carriages that are coming in 2020. That doesn't make me feel better about the hell of the last year and the large amount of money that I'm paying for the privilege.

items.title: 1 Month into being a commuter and I already want to quit
items.review_text:
I started my new job a little over a month ago. I travel from Worcester to Birmingham from Monday to Friday. 

In this short space of time I have already seriously considered giving up a job that is otherwise perfect purely because of this appalling train service. 

The journey in to work (8.24am) is generally ok for me. There have been few delays and I usually get a seat. Unfortunately the same cannot be said for passengers getting on a few stops further down the line - they are guaranteed to be standing every day as there are simply not enough carriages. 

The journey home has been nothing short of a nightmare right from the start. Trains are regularly delayed, too full to board or cancelled altogether at short notice. A classic example was 5/12/19, in which 3 of my trains in a row were cancelled. When the first train to run again finally arrived (with only 3 carriages), it was so horrifically cramped that the majority of passengers were not able to board and were left standing on the platform. If the previous 3 trains had been cancelled, could more carriages not have been added onto this train? In addition to the normal passengers for this train, a later Bromsgrove train was also cancelled meaning passengers for said train were also having to board ours. How cramped this train was was utterly inhumane and this is far from a one off occurrence. 

In the time I have been commuting I have managed to get a seat on the train home twice. Standing, in carriages so full you don't even have room to wriggle out of your coat, is the norm but by this point you are simply feeling lucky that you even managed to board at all. Every day whilst at work I am constantly worrying about the state of the trains home, anxiously checking and rechecking whether they have been cancelled yet and wondering if I will actually make it home tonight. 

And the best part? We are all paying a small fortune for the privilege of enduring this circus every day. Something drastically needs to be done and it needs to be done NOW.

items.title: Since taking over from London Midland
items.review_text: Since taking over from London Midland, West Midland Railway have been running an increasingly poor service, commuters are faced with never ending delays and cancellations. They have the audacity to start charging for car parking in village stations run by pirate parking companies, issuing fines without any remorse. Customers are becoming increasing fed up with appalling quality of service. Company Directors need to be held publicly accountable for their woeful incompetence and inadequacy. All this in the face of news that fares are due to increase in 2020. WMR are just laughing in the face of their customers.

items.title: Shame on you
items.review_text: Nothing will change and folks will feel justified hopping on and off services and waiting to pay for their ticket on the train if requested to do so. It has to work both ways. If there is little or no service due to cancelled or late trains then why should folks pay. Revenue inspectors once in a blue moon are hardly a deterrent. Mr Camp’s interview was padded out with waffle and no amount of words or excuses can redeem this totally shambolic company. Thank God my scooter is repaired as of tomorrow. I feel very sorry for those who have to tolerate this third world service on a daily basis and pay for their season tickets. Mr Camp made no mention of offering customers their money back. Funny that!

items.title: Overpromised, under-delivered, a further deterioration on the cross-city line
items.review_text:
I was quite hopeful when I heard they were taking over from London Midland. Promises of new trains, better service, investment...

A few years later, nothing. We're on shorter trains, which are more overcrowded and therefore run late every day.

Some new carriages have been introduced, but they seem to have a poorer seating pattern than the outgoing ones. Not that you're getting a seat anyway, it's standing room only - if you can actually get on the train. They're frequently so full you're left standing on the platform.

No sign of the long-promised 6 coach trains. Every train is a heaving hulk of compressed, angry human flesh.

They've adopted all the worst practices of London Midland, and found innovative ways to make it worse. The cross-city line is under permanent and lasting decline under this operator.

Roll on nationalisation!

items.title: diabolical service
items.review_text:
I have to get 4 trains a day to get to work and back. The service is so bad it’s depressing sometimes it takes me 3 hours to get home due to cancellations and delays. Sometimes I have to pay to get a bus otherwise I wouldn’t get to work or get home.
I consider quitting my job on a regular basis just so I don’t have the stress of catching a train with West Midlands railway.
For the price I pay a month plus any bus fare I have to pay and wages lost due to being late for work its a disgrace.

items.title: Almost always late during peak times
items.review_text: Their services have often been late but the last month it has been 90% of the time. I actually can’t remember the last time a train was on time during peak periods.

items.title: I have used west Midlands railways 3…
items.review_text: I have used west Midlands railways 3 times the last 2 weeks.  Absolutely awful.  No information no staff trains just sat at new st station 2 out of the 3 trains left 40 minutes late one didn't leave at all. Just no information no staff score minus one

items.title: First and last booking with these!
items.review_text:
I booked a first class return ticket from Crewe to London Euston. 
Complaint number one. I was not given the option of reserving a seat. Fine if the train is quiet, but I’d be livid if I paid first class prices and had to stand for three hours. 
Complaint number two. I was not informed that the train had no catering facilities. At all. Not even a coffee machine. First class usually includes refreshments. Not with this shambolic company. I couldn’t even pay for a coffee so my 3.5hr journey was awful. 
Complaint number three. Dirty, shabby & very worn seats. A disgrace. 
I will never use this train company again and urge anyone reading this to take notice and buy your tickets from someone else.

items.title: Never again
items.review_text:
Never again - terrible service

They cancel services then want to argue with you telling you to buy a new ticket as pre-booked ticket has original train time on it... REALLY?

items.title: Worst train service ever
items.review_text: Worst train service ever delays cancelled trains snowhill to oldhill. This needs sorting we pay a lot for our pass. You’re a joke

items.title: Hit 'em where it hurts.
items.review_text:
4 consecutive journeys delayed or cancelled:

This week - PLANNED disruption to services; they allowed too many staff to take leave and so knew they would not be able to run a full service, especially at peak times BUT kept their customers in the dark about it.

I can't believe so many passengers affected are not submitting DELAY - REPAY claims.

Hit 'em where it hurts: Search WM DELAY REPAY

items.title: A regular weekly occurrence of…
items.review_text: A regular weekly occurrence of trains,delayed, no drivers or 3 carriages instead of 6.  Come back London Midlands, all is forgiven

items.title: This is a shambles!
items.review_text:
This is a shambles!

Sitting on a platform, stranded again.

London Midland did it better.
It seems that West Midlands followed good practices for the initial 6 months, then binned the manual.
Every day a disaster of - late/cancelled/and leaving too early. 
Overstretched, miss-managed and woefully run!

Last week I overheard a conversation discussing industrial action by their staff. 

Very well done, you’ve managed to reenact the good ol seventies.

items.title: Passengers on the West Coast line…
items.review_text: Passengers on the West Coast line suffered for years with the continuous poor service provided by London Midland so were elated when West Midlands Trains took over the franchise.  Unfortunately the service is worse now than it was before.  I lose more money every month being late for work due to cancelled and late trains than the cost of my monthly rail pass.  A day rarely passes that there isn't an issue (cancelled/delayed/ overcrowded trains, staffing issues etc).  A truly awful service that appears to be getting worse.

items.title: This is the worst train service ever
items.review_text: This is the worst train service ever! Services are constantly delayed or cancelled, making you late for work etc. I have been standing at birmingham snow hill trying to get a train to galton bridge for half an hour! Avoid them if you can.

items.title: There is no a day when trains are…
items.review_text: There is no a day when trains are either cancelled or delayed but a ticket prices are raising I suppose the incompetence must be rewarded.

items.title: Decent service as always
items.review_text: Decent service as always - reasonable facilities

items.title: Worst train service
items.review_text: Worst train service. EVERYDAY Trains are always delayed or cancelled. Overcrowded with 3 carriages at peak times. No explanation no apologies. They have the nerve to have police, metal detectors and fine people at Longbridge this week. They want to put that money in there crap service and maybe More people would pay there train fair. Joke of a company and joke of a train service.

items.title: Simply not good enough
items.review_text: Whilst I recognise that investment is on the way and promises made whats the point of having new trains if West Mids Rail continue to run them so very badly.  Late, over crowded and cancelled trains are a way of life on the Shrewsbury Birmingham line. I agree London Midlend were marginally better. My travel in Europe shows how the railway system can be run and the UK model is fundamentally broken.  West Mids Railway is simply not up to the job.

items.title: Could it get any worse? Probably!
items.review_text: Thought last company to run this route was bad but that was before I discovered just how bad a railway can be run. My usual train was only 3, instead of 6 carriages (this happens frequently with no explanation given), therefore it was impossible to get on at Selly Oak Station to New Street. This resulted in the next train - 10 minutes later - being overcrowded so couldn't get on this one and, 10 minutes later, I just managed to cram myself on to the 3rd train. No explanation for lack of carriages and their mess-ups happen every day with stupid excuses like "too many passengers" - hint, put more carriages on, "no train crew" - hint, cut your bonuses and hire more people. Whoever awarded them the franchise should try travelling with this Company. They're a disgrace.

items.title: WORST TRAINS EVER
items.review_text: WORST TRAINS EVER. Everyday there is a problem. EVERY DAY

items.title: Uttter utter sh+=e.
items.review_text: Uttter utter sh+=e.

items.title: London Midland were bad, but WM Trains has to be the worst to ever us this line
items.review_text:
It is a rarity for the trains back to Solihull from Birmingham to be on time.  If a train is late by 10 minutes or more,  they will run it straight to Dorridge,  without calling at any stations on the way.  This seems to happen at least several times a month.  The excuse they use, is that it is done to stop delays to trains running behind that train.  That is total rubbish, as those later trains are delayed anyway.  If there was a train immediately behind it, they would have a point.   

The people running WM Trains must be backward, and the general opinion is that London Midland were far superior,  and London Midland were not exactly the best, but at least if a train was running let, you could still board it and get to your destination.  

They respond to complaints by saying you can claim for compensation using their delay repay scheme.  This is another waste of time, as their website is deliberately designed to make this as time consuming as possible, and even them, you are lucky if you end up getting £1.

items.title: Awful
items.review_text: Awful. Always late. Never enough train drivers. Cancellations meaning cramped carriages. Expensive monthly pass for a load of nonsense.

items.title: I never thought I would say this but…
items.review_text: I never thought I would say this but London Midpand please come back all is forgiven. West Midlands Railway is the most inept, incompetent and awful service provider in recent memory. Firstly let me just say that sometimes problems occur with transport services that sometimes is out of their hands. However in that case the company should do the best they can to sort them and have a pro-active approach to problem resolution. WMR have never had this and fall apart at the slightest hint of an issue. Trains are cancelled at the drop of a hat, often-times with no explanation given. Train cancellations because of a shortage of crew members has become an almost-daily occurrence, but little is being done to solve these issues because they keep occurring. Forget about new payment machines and paintwork for the carriages, why not invest in staffing levels and infrastructure which will improve a woeful service. Why are the chieftains of this company not doing anything to alleviate the shocking service levels. I pay monthly for my train pass. lateness has become so common-place that I think I am now desensitised to it. When London Midland let you down it was actually for a valid reason, their service was so much better than WMR. If we have a cold winter this season they will be in absolute disarray and monthly pass holders like me will be walking home.

items.title: The worst service there is!
items.review_text: Worst service ever.  Always delayed always some sort of problem.  Everyday they come out with excuses why its late.  Stops halfway sometimes.  I have constantly had to wait for ages or ben told last minute train has been cancelled and its beyond a joke.  Even London Midland was not as bad as this.  Im given it 1 star as I cant untick that otherwise it would have got nothing.  WMR ceo's need to take the service to see what passengers go through on a daily basis instead of sitting on their backsides counting their profits.  They say they have new trains coming ion 2020 well we dont need new trains we need time management.  And if you do get new trains please make sure they are leaf proof because im sure that will soon be another excuse why they are always running late as you seem to have used every other excuse.  Enjoy your bonuses WMR CEO's doing a great job.

items.title: Best way to waste moneys
items.review_text: Every day something happens; a lot of cancellations and delays! SHAME .. take an Uber or a bus and you will arrive at destination.

items.title: West Midlands railway is an atrocious…
items.review_text:
West Midlands railway is an atrocious service that doesn’t have the staff to carry out its alleged timetable.

There are regular cancellations between Stourbridge and Birmingham, regular delays between Smethwick and Wolverhampton, and they constantly cite “lack of available train crew” as the reason.

I have just got into a taxi after my 23.10
Service home from Birmingham will no longer stop at my local stations tonight, with no reason given. 

£20+ to get home, on top of the £80 a month I pay West Midlands railway for a service that simply is not fit for purpose. Deluded company.

items.title: Half-arsed approach to customer service.
items.review_text: Booked my tickets 3 weeks in advance, however ny mistake I had selected the wrong railcard. And 2 weeks before my journey I had realised so I contacted them to try and amend the tickets. But was told they couldn't be amended, instead I had to take a refund, BUT there was a £10 cancellation fee. My tickets only cost £15 in the first place, and I still wanted/ needed the tickets, and even with the correct railcard applied the ticket price was still exactly the same. But now I have no ticket, and I'm £10 out of pocket just because someone couldnt/ wouldnt change one detail on my ticket. It's absolutely ridiculous and I refuse to believe that it couldnt have been amended. I wadnt given any apology, just a cold matter of fact tone, a kind of if you dont like it then it's tough. I would have either have to spend the £15 again on the same tickets with the correct railcard, or accept the £5 refund and rebook the tickets.

items.title: General poor service on the Birmingham to Lichfield line
items.review_text:
General poor service on the Birmingham to Lichfield cross city line every evening. Rammed, overcrowded trains that have never been extended as promised. 

Poor operational decisions to terminate and turn around trains before Lichfield often lead to extended delays for Lichfield passengers.

This company has not learned from thet shortcomings of its predecessor; rather, it has repeated their mistakes with a big silly grin and added many of their own.

An enormous opportunity for improvement missed.

Update: This has only gotten worse.

Their service over the autumn/winter period was, frankly, horrific. Many occaisions when trains weren't running at all, or with severe delay.

One experience that really stood out was when I was trying to get back to Lichfield Trent Valley, *five* successive trains had a problem or another. They even managed to smack one of them into the barriers as a bonus mistake. Train then took 5 minutes to get moving.

Back to work in the new year, day 1 in the office and there are two train cancellations in a row. 3 weeks into January and it's pretty much "delay repay every day" territory.

When you review their performance data offered online, they are typically the cause of their own problems, as opposed to National Rail / other operators.

I can only conclude that they are unable, unwilling or simply incapable of running the service. The cross-city line seems in terminal decline. Lichfield Trent Valley passengers in particulary are treated with contempt, as if it's an optional treat for us to get home. 

Recently had numerous rush-hour trains called (0820, 0840) from trent valley. They send a 6-person taxi as an alternative. 28 people left waiting. Most just trekked down to city on foot.

Strip the franchise!

items.title: Always late or cancelled and…
items.review_text:
Always late or cancelled and overcrowded. Awful service. Most trains doesn't have air con either, so it's super hot, smelly and uncomfortable.
Trains are so hot,you can't breathe. There's hot air pumped into carriages ,it's unbearable. It could be +40 outside or 0 degrees, there's always dangerously hot in there trains. It's not ok!!! They also provide only 4 carriages on peak times,there's never available seats,there's been few times people are taken ill as no air and people fainting
